dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think a free trip to the Great Wall of China would be amazing, but actually this HostelWorld contest sounds like a punishment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think a free trip to the Great Wall of China would be amazing, but actually this HostelWorld contest sounds like a punishment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They need to enter by 11:59 PM Beijing time on August 11th on the listing page for the Great Wall on Airbnbs site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? They're literally putting people in a repurposed subway car with scratchy wool blankets and random vending machine meals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? They're literally putting people in a repurposed subway car with scratchy wool blankets and random vending machine meals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The accommodations will be located in one of the towers, a large bed installed with fine quality linens and blanketsnecessary because although plexiglass will cover the ceiling and windows allowing the moon and stars to show through, theres also the possibility of cool night air. A dining table will be set up for a multi course Chinese banquet, each course illustrating a particular aspect of Chinese culture, and accompanied by traditional musicians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they have to write an essay about building walls between cultures to even enter—like, uh, that's such a weird requirement for a travel company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they have to write an essay about building walls between cultures to even enter-like, uh, that's such a weird requirement for a travel company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To enter, participants need to do a bit of writing, explaining why it is more important now than ever to break down barriers between cultures and how they want to build new connections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the wake-up call is the sunset so you can jog the whole 3,170 mile wall? I don't think so.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the wake-up call is the sunset so you can jog the whole three thousand, one hundred seventy mile wall? I don't think so.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sunrise functions as a wake up call for guests to hike through the countryside surrounding the 13,170 mile long Wall.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, public bathrooms? Or you just use the park's facilities? That's not exactly luxury.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, public bathrooms? Or you just use the park's facilities? That's not exactly luxury.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Portable bathrooms are being brought in (or guests can wander down the Wall to permanent facilities.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's only for two nights in September, but hey, at least you get rail tickets to Tokyo if you win, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's only for two nights in September, but hey, at least you get rail tickets to Tokyo if you win, I guess?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The four winners (plus a guest each) will be in residence for a night each during the time period September 4-8th and other non-Wall prizes are includedair tickets to Beijing from the nearest international airport (or ground transport if the winner lives within 100 miles of Beijing), a regular Airbnb accommodation between September 3-9 (except for the night on the Wall) and three meals a day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then there's also this amateur historian giving lectures for 26 years worth of history? Like, is that really a vacation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there's also this amateur historian giving lectures for twenty six years worth of history? Like, is that really a vacation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Official historians will be alongside to detail the 2600 years of history, the contributions of the various dynasties, intricacies of construction and purpose along with current preservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels more like a, um, very specific kind of endurance challenge. And they're promoting it while their Japan listings dropped 25%? Suspicious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels more like a, um, very specific kind of endurance challenge. And they're promoting it while their Japan listings dropped twenty five percent? Suspicious.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the activities are just karaoke and anime, which, you know, you could do anywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the activities are just karaoke and anime, which, you know, you could do anywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Guests will also be given the opportunity to learn other aspects of Chinese culture such as calligraphy and seal engraving, activities generally offered on other, more typical, Airbnb stays, before they depart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it's basically a PR stunt wrapped in a… deeply un-fun experience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's basically a P R stunt wrapped in a... deeply un-fun experience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, bragging rights are non-existent, like the article says. Who brags about sleeping in a subway car?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, bragging rights are non-existent, like the article says. Who brags about sleeping in a subway car?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the four who win, the experience will truly be unique and the bragging rights unquestioned.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the deadline's August 21st—hard pass from me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the deadline's August twenty first-hard pass from me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They need to enter by 11:59 PM Beijing time on August 11th on the listing page for the Great Wall on Airbnbs site.

HostA: Plus, public bathrooms? Or you just use the park’s facilities? That’s not exactly luxury.
HostB: And it’s only for two nights in September, but hey, at least you get rail tickets to Tokyo if you win, I guess?
HostA: But then there’s also this amateur historian giving lectures for 26 years worth of history? Like, is that really a vacation?
HostB: It feels more like a, um, very specific kind of endurance challenge. And they’re promoting it while their Japan listings dropped 25%? Suspicious.
HostA: Exactly. And the activities are just karaoke and anime, which, you know, you could do anywhere.
HostB: So it’s basically a PR stunt wrapped in a… deeply un-fun experience.
HostA: Yeah, bragging rights are non-existent, like the article says. Who brags about sleeping in a subway car?
HostB: Right? And the deadline’s August 21st—hard pass from me.
